thread.title: Setback in Cruz's return
thread.title_full: Setback in Cruz's return - Times Union

author: timesunion.com
title: Setback in Cruz's return
text:
East Rutherford, N.J.
Two days after Victor Cruz said he expected to play this weekend, his return seemingly is on hold.
Giants coach Tom Coughlin said that Cruz was unable to practice Wednesday after feeling some discomfort in his calf.
The wide receiver participated in some individual drills, but he had to shut it down before the team phase of practice.
"Hopefully it's just minor," quarterback Eli Manning said. "I know he has been working hard since the knee injury. It's always frustrating for everybody when you are injured.
"You want to be out there. It's something that is nagging with a muscle strain. It's not fun for anybody. He's got a great attitude toward it and hopefully he can continue to heal up and get out there when he can."
Manning didn't see Cruz get hurt in the individual drills, but he noticed he did not take part in all of them.
Cruz was not in the locker room after practice and was unavailable for comment.
The 28-year-old Cruz has not played in a game since suffering a season-ending knee injury on Oct. 12 against the Philadelphia Eagles . He had surgery and rehabilitation and came to training camp hoping to play in the season opener. He pulled a calf muscle in mid-August and has not practiced.
Cruz had said on Monday that his calf felt fine and he was excited at the prospect of playing again and being one of the league's outstanding receivers.
"Victor came out and tried to do individuals," Coughlin said in a statement. "He felt the calf again and that's all he did."
Bills: Coach Rex Ryan says there's a "real possibility" running back LeSean McCoy will not play against the Giants on Sunday because of a nagging injury to his left hamstring. However, he won't entirely rule out McCoy from playing. The injury has nagged and slowed McCoy since he was hurt during a joint practice with the Cleveland Browns on Aug. 18. McCoy sat out Buffalo's final preseason games before playing a limited role in a season-opening win over Indianapolis on Sept. 13.
Jets: Receiver Eric Decker remains sidelined by a sprained left knee that could cause him to miss a second straight game. Cornerback Darrelle Revis has a hamstring issue, but says he should be fine. Running back Chris Ivory is dealing with a strained quadriceps that kept him out against the Eagles.
